intro: Dampiera brownii, commonly known as the silver leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its silvery, woolly foliage and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing drought tolerance. Dampiera brownii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
